We offer universal, hassle-free appointment-based and walk-in medical and counseling services at either no cost or very reduced cost to all NYU students , regardless of insurance coverage. Our goal is to add great value to the NYU experience for students and great comfort in knowing that a safety net for basic healthcare exists at NYU.     The SHC is accredited by the Accreditation Association for Ambulatory Health Care , placing it among the top university health centers in the country. We offer universal, hassle-free appointment-based and walk-in medical and counseling services at either no cost or very reduced cost to all NYU students , regardless of insurance coverage. Our goal is to add great value to the NYU experience for students and great comfort in knowing that a safety net for basic healthcare exists at NYU.     The SHC is accredited by the Accreditation Association for Ambulatory Health Care , placing it among the top university health centers in the country. Often, the best way to join is to find contact details on their — or on NYU OrgSync — and reach out to express interest.          News     NYU Local  Independent news blog run by NYU students founded in 2008. NYU Local covers discussion and news     Washington Square News  Independent student newspaper founded in 1973. WSN is published Monday through Thursday during the academic year          Radio     WNYU  Student-led radio station streaming online and broadcasting on 89.1 FM            Magazines / Other     Aftab  Literary magazine of the Islamic Center at New York University. Serves as a creative outlet for members of the community to express and exchange their thoughts and ideas   Baedeker  A forum for students who love to travel — whether it be a cross country road trip or a cross the pond jaunt in Europe   Generasian  Asian American interest publication. Prints a magazine twice a year and publishes blogs regularly about a range of issues   The Headless Society  "We are about letting loose and writing without constraints." Original prompts run by a different member each week spark the creative process. The Headless Society publishes The Guillotine , a literary magazine, each semester   Jewish Voice  Publication featuring student stories in association with the Bronfman Center for Jewish Student Life   Humanus  NYU's student-led Journal of Human Rights publishes a magazine each semester and hosts events throughout the year   Journal of Politics and International Affairs  Student-run journal published twice yearly with a focus on politics and international affairs   Medical Dialogue Review  Bridges the gap between science and the humanities. MDR is a peer-reviewed journal published twice a year aiming to reflect the diversity of the healthcare profession   Minetta Review  The Minetta Review is a literary and arts publication managed by undergraduate students. Established in 1974, it is the oldest literary publication at New York University   The Plague  Comedy magazine published each semester, complete with satirical articles, humorous fiction, and weird pictures   Seed  NYU's student-led Christian publication                                            NYU Club Fest   Club Fest brings together NYU clubs under one roof for the semester's largest recruiting event. Get to know NYU clubs as members share information and answer your questions. Club Fest happens twice a year: once in the fall semester, then again at the beginning of the spring semester. Learn more »                       Visit CSALS     The Center for Student Activities, Leadership, and Service — located in Kimmel Suite 704 — provides opportunities to discover and build your on-campus community. Learn more »                       Featured Events     Various events and programs hosted by Student Affairs throughout the year provide exciting ways for students to explore campus, take advantage of New York City, meet peers, and engage with relevant issues.
